current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To direct the Secretary of the Interior, acting through the Bureau of Land Management and the
			 Bureau of Reclamation, to convey, by quitclaim deed, to the City of
			 Fernley, Nevada, all right, title, and interest of the United States, to
			 any Federal land within that city that is under the jurisdiction of either
			 of those agencies.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
In this Act:

term.#tail: means the City of Fernley, Nevada.

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the City for conveyance under this Act.

term.#tail:
means the approximately 9,407 acres of land located in the City of Fernley, Nevada, that is
			 identified by the

text.#text: The term
The term

receives an offer from the City to purchase the Federal

), to the City
			 in exchange for consideration in an amount equal to the fair market value

text.#text: Subject to valid existing rights and not later than 180 days after the date on which the

The map shall be on file and available for public inspection in the appropriate offices of the

the operation and maintenance of the Truckee Canal; or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as appropriate, for the reasonable transaction and

text.#text: The City shall, at closing for the conveyance authorized under

A conveyance or a combination of conveyances made under this section shall not be considered a
			 major Federal action for purposes of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 102(2) of the National
			 Environmental Policy Act of 1969

header.#text: Conveyance not a major federal action

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, notwithstanding any other provision of law, the United
			 States is released from any and all liabilities or claims of any kind or
			 nature arising from the presence, release, or threat of release of any
			 hazardous substance, pollutant, contaminant, petroleum product (or
			 derivative of a petroleum product of any kind), solid waste, mine
			 materials or mining related features (including tailings, overburden,
			 waste rock, mill remnants, pits, or other hazards resulting from the
			 presence of mining related features) on the Federal land in existence on
			 or before the date of the conveyance.

text.#text: Upon making the conveyance under

shall

text.#text: Subject to valid existing rights, the Federal land to be conveyed under
entry, appropriation, or disposal under the public land laws;
location, entry, and patent under the mining laws; and
disposition under the mineral leasing, mineral materials, and geothermal leasing laws.
